snippet: The Bronx district attorney’s office said that it would not charge William Rockefeller, who fell asleep as the train approached a sharp curve, in the accident that left four people dead.
abstract: Bronx district attorney's office declines to bring charges against William Rockefeller, Metro-North Railroad engineer who fell asleep on train in 2013 before it hurtled off rails, killing four people; cites Rockefeller's sleep apnea; announcement coincides with investigation of deadly Amtrak derailment.
lead_paragraph: The Bronx district attorney’s office said that it would not charge William Rockefeller, who fell asleep as the train approached a sharp curve, in the accident that left four people dead.

headline.main: No Charges for Engineer in 2013 Fatal Metro-North Derailment
headline.print_headline: No Charges for Engineer in Derailment in the Bronx
